channel.title: Ok almost got it,
channel.description:
ok so, in order to store a varaible publicly i need to use this,
[code]public class targetname{ targetname2=codethatihavethatworks }[/code]
then in clickingmost.java i would use this,
[code]c.targetname.targetname2[/code]
as there name,
but u cant declare public anything in case events AKA my CLICK event

item.title: Ok almost got it,
item.dc:creator: @yugioh101 yugioh101
item.description:
@yugioh101 wrote:

ok this is how im going to try to explain it,

in client.java i have this code,

case 139: ResetAttack(); if ((playerRights >= 1)){ int pIndex2 = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndian(); client p5 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[pIndex2]; client targetname = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(p5.playerName)]; int pIndex2 = inStream.readUnsignedWordBigEndian(); client p5 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[pIndex2]; client targetname = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(p5.playerName)]; sendQuest("Moderator Options for player:"+p5.playerName, 15003); showInterface(15000); sM("Welcome to the Mod Controll Pannel for "+playerName ); }
case 139 is supposed to be follow but for mods+ it shows player options

and that opens my custom interface and stores the p5.playername var which is the other persons name that i clicked on.

now in my custom interface i have 4 buttons,

warn,
kick,
mute,
jail,

now i go into my clickingmost.java file and declare

case warnbtncase#here: c.p5.sM("you have been warned"); break;

so im trying to use the p5 var from my client.java in my clickingmost.java file to be able to use the kick options but i need to be able to store the players name so it knows WHO its doing the command on…?

do u get it now or do i need to explain differently

Read full topic
